title: AIPAC Attacks Rep Greene For Breaking With Republicans On Israel: 'Disgusting'
summary: AIPAC Attacks Rep Greene For Breaking With Republicans On Israel: 'Disgusting' Authored by Dave DeCamp via AntiWar.com, The pro-Israel lobby group AIPAC is attacking Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-GA) after she became the first Republican member of Congress to label Israel‚Äôs...
fullContent: AIPAC Attacks Rep Greene For Breaking With Republicans On Israel: 'Disgusting' Authored by Dave DeCamp via AntiWar.com, The pro-Israel lobby group AIPAC is attacking Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-GA) after she became the first Republican member of Congress to label Israel‚Äôs actions against the Palestinians in Gaza a genocide. According to Al Jazeera, in a fundraising email to supporters on Thursday, AIPAC called Greene‚Äôs remarks ‚Äúdisgusting‚Äù and accused her of betraying ‚ÄúAmerican values‚Äù for calling Israel‚Äôs brutal campaign in Gaza a genocide, which aligns Greene with many human rights organizations and genocide scholars, including Israeli ones. Getty Images ‚ÄúYou expect anti-Israel smears from Rashida Tlaib and Ilhan Omar,‚Äù AIPAC said in the email, referring to two House Democrats known for their critical view of Israel. ‚ÄúBut now, Marjorie Taylor Greene has joined their ranks ‚Äì spouting the same vile rhetoric and voting against the US-Israel alliance.‚Äù AIPAC said Greene was now the ‚Äúnewest member of the anti-Israel Squad‚Äù and claimed her view was a ‚Äúbetrayal of American values and a dangerous distortion of the truth.‚Äù Greene has referred to Israel‚Äôs actions as genocide at least twice in posts on X. In her first post, Greene said that it‚Äôs ‚Äúthe most truthful and easiest thing to say that Oct 7th in Israel was horrific and all hostages must be returned, but so is the genocide, humanitarian crisis, and starvation happening in Gaza.‚Äù In another post, the Georgia congresswoman said many Americans are ‚Äúagainst radical Islamic terrorism, but we are also against genocide.‚Äù She has also repeatedly referred to Israel as ‚Äúnuclear-armed Israel,‚Äù making her one of the first members of Congress to directly acknowledge Israel‚Äôs secret nuclear arsenal. AIPAC is known to spend big on pro-Israel candidates and is likely going to fund an opponent of Greene‚Äôs when she comes up for election again. AIPAC is sending fundraising emails attacking me for saying, ‚Äúthe most truthful and easiest thing to say that Oct 7th in Israel was horrific and all hostages must be returned, but so is the genocide, humanitarian crisis, and starvation happening in Gaza.‚Äù Well this is the sign‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/AF3RUrAWAY ‚Äî Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greeneüá∫üá∏ (@RepMTG) August 7, 2025 The pro-Israel group has also targeted Rep. Thomas Massie (R-KY), the only other Republican in Congress to offer significant criticism of Israel and who consistently votes against aid to Israel. Tyler Durden Fri, 08/08/2025 - 09:10

summary: In a major U-turn in energy policy, Mexico has unveiled a 10-year plan to reverse a years-long decline in oil and gas production by tapping more unconventional resources through fracking. Petroleos Mexicanos, or Pemex, the world‚Äôs most indebted energy firm, has seen declines...
fullContent: In a major U-turn in energy policy, Mexico has unveiled a 10-year plan to reverse a years-long decline in oil and gas production by tapping more unconventional resources through fracking. Petroleos Mexicanos, or Pemex, the world‚Äôs most indebted energy firm, has seen declines in its output in recent years as old shallow-water conventional fields mature. title: Tariffs Dominate Earnings Calls on Wall Street
Egypt Shuns Millions of Barrels of Oil Cargoes in Shift to LNG
summary: Egypt gave up on more than 2 million barrels of petroleum cargoes it offered to buy when gas supplies from Israel were briefly cut, after securing massive amounts of LNG to help meet its electricity generation needs.
fullContent: Egypt gave up on more than 2 million barrels of petroleum cargoes it offered to buy when gas supplies from Israel were briefly cut, after securing massive amounts of LNG to help meet its electricity generation needs.

title: A New Economic Logic for Sustainability
summary: Sustainability initiatives will never achieve transformative change, because the current economic framework is structurally misaligned with planetary and societal boundaries. A better form of capitalism, under which the most sustainable strategies are also the most profitable,...
fullContent: Sustainability initiatives will never achieve transformative change, because the current economic framework is structurally misaligned with planetary and societal boundaries. A better form of capitalism, under which the most sustainable strategies are also the most profitable, is possible, if corporate leaders have the courage to act.
